Hi Arvind,

You should probably rather send this email to the Cactus mailing list
(see the cactus web site for more information).

Cheers,
-Vincent

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Arvind Sharma [mailto:mailtoarvind@...]
> Sent: 02 January 2003 11:02
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Cactus Test on EJB
> 
> Hi,
>       I am testing a session Bean using cactus. I have
> my test class which calls a particular method of the
> session bean. I deployed it in a WAR File giving
> session bean ref in ejb-ref tag in web.xml. I run my
> test from browser using
> http://(SERVER):8081/posmontest/ServletTestRunner?suite=(CLASS
> NAME)
> 
> It gives me the following Error in my tomcat Log
> [INFO,wire] << "HTTP/1.0 500 Internal Server Error"
> [\r\n]
> [INFO,wire] << "Content-Type: text/html" [\r\n]
> [INFO,wire] << "Servlet-Engine: Tomcat Web
> Server/3.2.3 (JSP 1.1; Servlet 2.2; Java 1.4.0_01;
> Linux 2.4.7-10 i386; java.vendor=Sun Microsystems
> Inc.)" [\r\n]
> [INFO,wire] << "<h1>Error: 500</h1>
> <h2>Location:
> /posmontest/ServletRedirector</h2><b>Internal Servlet
> Error:</b><br><pre>java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
>         at
> sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native
> Method)
>         at
>
sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorA
cc
> essorImpl.java:39)
> 
> I doubt the error is caused when the following code is
> executed
>     public static Test suite()
>     {
>         return new TestSuite(MyBeanTest.class);
>     }
> 
> Can anyone tell me what could be the error
> 
> Regards
> Arvind
